column5: My brother and sister are coming in from Britain. Havent seen them since my Dad passed away 4 years ago. They have both rented a cottage on Clear Lake off 118 in near Bracebridge. Just wondering if anyone has fished this lake / knows this lake and can advise what I may find there fish wise. . Going to check the MNR website, but not real confident of the reliability factor there. Thanks.
My neighbours have a cottage there, from what I hear, there is some bass and plenty of panfish and the odd hammerhandle pike that they don't want in the lake. That's about it. Could be some fun.

Call the Bracebridge MNR office....if you ask to speak to one of the biologists, you can often get some good info.   A bit hit and miss, as they don't know every lake by heart...but worth a call. I'd expect bass for sure in that area.
Thanks guys - MNR web site says ----- Lake trout Brook trout, bass , pike etc etc etc. Pan fish and bass will work for me.
Never fished it, but Ive fished at 3mile lake if its close by. Theres a free ramp and some decent bass to be had . The walters are hard to come by from what I was told.
